nodes.text: Typhojem, or Typhojem, the Left-Handed God, was a deity worshipped by the Kissai. Following the end of the Hundred-Year Darkness, the Dark Jedi Ajunta Pall appointed himself as the leader of the Sith, and the Sith's Kissai priests hailed Pall as a manifestation of Typhojem.

Daniel Wallace included Typhojem in the Book of Sith at the recommendation of Abel G. Peña. Author Joe Bongiorno had originally planned to detail Typhojem in his submitted Hyperspace novella "Supernatural Encounters: The Trial and Transformation of Arhul Hextrophon" but the story was never published following the cancellation of the Hyperspace service. He has hinted that Typhojem was Tilotny's firstborn, as well as later being worshiped under the name Pomojema.
